data: In the shade of Pedro Vijil’s little brown adobe on the Granados rancho, a horseman squatted to repair a broken cinch with strips of rawhide, while his horse—a strong dappled roan with a smutty face—stood near, the rawhide bridle over his head and the quirt trailing the ground.
Pedro Vijil’s little brown adobe | Granados rancho

In the shade of Pedro Vijil's little brown adobe on the Granados rancho, a horseman squatted to repair a broken cinch with strips of rawhide, while his horse--a strong dappled roan with a smutty face--stood near, the rawhide bridle over his head and the quirt trailing the ground.
The Treasure Trail: A Romance of the Land of Gold and Sunshine
Ryan, Marah Ellis, 1866-1934; Amick, Robert Wesley, 1879-1969 [Illustrator]
